{{champion:110}} I don't know what he is talking about at all.
Dinkleberg and everything after is pure gold. I also refuse to add "Dinkleberg" to my dictionary.
I have many questions about the Wendy's one.

Sheen's Ultra Lord reminds me. 

As a Viktor main, it tilts me to no end that "Perfect Hex Core" was not named "Hex Core mk-Ultra" after Project MKULTRA, the CIA program that created the Unabomber. Not only is it a pun on the British "mark #" versioning system, but it fits Viktor's lore as a disillusioned, academically-inclined revolutionary. Except -- rather than halt technological advance, Viktor wants to accelerate it.
I glanced at this post a few times and every time I thought it said "don't do krugs kids"
I mean no one does them anyways

i do as kayn on blue team, nothing like starting the enemy chickens to red then krugs
dont do refillables kids

Coincidentally, I suspect Aatrox and Kayn were inspired by _Elric of Melnibone_. It's a high-fantasy series, starring the eponymous Elric. He's an albino/emperor/rockstar/drug-addict who wields a sentient vampiric sword (the bloodlust of which he struggles to control). 

It was published during the 70's. Although I found the premise interesting, I couldn't finish it because the author wrote on a 6th-grade level. I guess Tolkien spoiled me. It wouldn't surprise me if Elric were indeed the inspiration. Riot has a long record of making obscure referrences. E.g. Ekko was clearly inspired by _The Girl Who Leapt Through Time_.
